story: Ahmad Alfy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: All About Angular 2.0
caption: eisenbergeffect.bluespire.com
description: Have questions about the strategy for Angular 2.0? This is the place. In the following article I'll explain the major feature areas of Angular 2.0 along with the motivations behind any changes. Following each section, I'll provide you...

data.message:
RT @Meligy: Writer of viral "All about Angular 2" post, creator of #DurandalJS &new WIP Angular router,is leaving #AngularJS team
http://t.co/B3JKT9Cg0T

wow .. that escalated quickly I was just listening to a podcast came out yesterday about the conflict he is in ... How is he gonna keep up with Durandal and leading Angular at the same time! Thanks Meligy
He is not going to lead Angular. He left the team already.

Frankly it was kinda expected. The nice things about Durandal like the shell and stuff are very different from Angular. It felt too to be true that Angular would care about these. But he didn't have a lot of choice. His Durandal kickstarter failed and it was obvious he was losing against Angular
Hisham Abd El-Hafez Eid I am yet to learn the existing one !!!!!
The funny thing though, his post about Angular 2 then this conflict are going to bring him a lot of empathy and get Durandal so much traction that was nor possible without these events!

JSJapper http://devchat.tv/js-jabber/132-jsj-mv-frameworks-with-craig-mckeachie ... Correction, it came out 4 days ago before he announced he was leaving. I may be misunderstood, I didn't mean Eisenberg was on the podcast ... It was Craig McKeachie and he was talking about how he revamped the routers and a lot about his  contributions.
I heard the name "Rob Eisenberg" for the first time a week ago ... and it popped up in my feeds and podcasts A LOT since then. I think he have something worthy.
